sentences.en: "Please understand this," she began, a tremble in her voice.
sentences.cn: “请理解这一点，”她开始说道，声音有些发颤。

sentences.en: A second grade wind makes the tips of the branches tremble slightly.
sentences.cn: 二级风可使树枝轻微颤动.

sentences.en: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.cn: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.en: His mouth became dry, his eyes widened, and he began to tremble all over.
sentences.cn: 他嘴唇发干,眼睛圆睁,全身开始颤抖起来.

sentences.en: I tremble at the thought of what may happen.
sentences.cn: 我想到可能出现的情况就不寒而栗.

sentences.en: I tremble to think of the consequences.
sentences.cn: 我为可能产生的后果而担心.

sentences.en: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.cn: 我永远都不会忘记那个病人脸上的表情,还有他颤抖的手.

sentences.en: Lotte heard the bell, all her limbs began to tremble.
sentences.cn: 绿蒂听见门铃声, 她全身发抖.

sentences.en: People tremble when they are cold, excited or full of fear.
sentences.cn: 人们在寒冷 、 激动或恐惧的时候,身体会发抖.

sentences.en: She was in a tremble of excitement and opposition as she spoke.
sentences.cn: 当她说话时,由于激动和反抗,她浑身颤抖.

sentences.en: The leaves tremble in the breeze.
The tapestry did but tremble in the wind, he shook.
sentences.cn: 壁毯还不过是在风中晃动, 他则是在大打寒战.

sentences.en: There was a tremble in her voice.
They can frighten you, scramble your brains, make you tremble.
sentences.cn: 他们可以恐吓你, 打破你的脑袋, 使你胆战心惊.

sentences.en: They made my heart tremble , my vein glow when I viewed them.
sentences.cn: 我望着它们就心儿颤抖, 热血沸腾.

words.tran_cn: 发抖地；震颤地；歪斜地；过分敏感地
震颤的东西；发抖的人；摇尾鸟

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)极度紧张，极为激动的

trans.tran_en: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
